title: Over 2 lakh fresh COVID-19 cases in India, 1038 new fatalities
description: A total of 2,00,739 new COVID-19 cases have been registered in a span of 24 hours, while death toll increased to 1,73,123 with 1,038 daily new fatalities, the highest since October 3, 2020, the data updated at 8 am showed. Registering a steady increase for the 36th day in a row, the active cases have increased to 14,71,877 comprising 10.46 per cent of the total infections

title: Covid impacts internship of BEd students
description: Second-year students of B.Ed colleges said they are worried that they could not complete School Internship Training (SIT) this academic year due to Covid -19 impact.

title: Round up of COVID-19 restrictions across India
description: India's total COVID-19 cases rose by 2 lakhs for the first time on Thursday and the active cases roses by nearly 1 lakh for the second straight day. Get latest Healthcare online at cnbctv18.com

title: Stalin backs vaccination for all, slams PM Modi for COVID-19 second wave
description: DMK president MK Stalin on Wednesday demanded for a universal COVID-19 vaccination drive in the country and blamed the 'lackadaisical’ attitude of the administration of the state and Union governments for the spread of COVID-19 in the country. The Leader of Opposition in the Tamil Nadu Assembly slammed the export of over 5.84 crore vaccine doses and also blamed the governments for failing to create adequate awareness among the people on the vaccination drive.

title: Tamil Nadu SHRC seeks report after doctor alleges assault by police in Madurai
description: The Tamil Nadu State Human Rights Commission has sought a report from the Madurai City Police Commissioner in connection with the alleged assault of a doctor. Based on a complaint filed by a homeopathic doctor Tamilarasan of Kalaivanan Nagar in Madurai, the commission has asked the Police Commissioner to give a detailed report on the alleged assault within three weeks of the notice. Tamilarasan, a homeopathic doctor on COVID-19 duty at the Government Rajaji Hospital in Madurai, was on his way to work on a two-wheeler on April 10 when he was intercepted by police at the BB Kulam junction.

title: LIVE News Updates: Telangana reports 3,307 new COVID-19 cases, 8 deaths take toll to 1,788
description: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal to hold a meeting with Lieutenant Governor Anil Baijal today over increasing COVID-19 cases in the national capital

title: S Africa suspends J&J COVID-19 vaccine
description: South Africa has joined the US in suspending its rollout of the Johnson and Johnson COVID-19 vaccine

title: Is Covid-19 playbook different for entrance exams, wonder students seeking deferment
description: The central government on Wednesday said that further decision on the conduct of Class 12 boards will be taken after June 1.

title: Tamil Nadu: Patients’ bodies swapped at Cuddalore hospital | Chennai News - Times of India
description: The bodies of a Covid-19 patient and an infectionfree patient were swapped at Cuddalore government general hospital due to a mistaken identity by thek

title: Coronavirus Live: Delhi reports 17,282 cases, 104 deaths in last 24 hours
description: Coronavirus live updates: India has recorded 184,372 fresh Covid cases and 1,025 deaths in the last 24 hrs. Janta curfew will be imposed in Maharashtra from today. Stay tuned for corona-related news

title: DMK chief demands vaccines for all
description: DMK president M.K. Stalin on Wednesday made a strong case for COVID-19 vaccination for all, instead of covering just those aged over 45. He said vaccines for all were necessary as the infection was sp

title: Tamil Nadu records 7,819 new Covid-19 infections, Chennai adds 2,564 cases
description: Chennai accounted for 2,564 new infections, taking the tally to 2,72,118. The metropolis also leads in the number of deaths with 4,344 fatalities.

title: COVID death: Mix-up at hospital sees Muslim family bury Hindu man in Tamil Nadu
description: On Wednesday morning, relatives of Zaheer Hussain and Arumugam collected the bodies and left for their respective villages.

title: Tamil Nadu class 10 board exams 2021 cancelled amid COVID-19 surge
description: Tamil Nadu government has postponed the class 10th and 12th board exams 2021. TN SSLC and HSLC exams have been postponed in view of COVID-19 pandemic.

title: In a week, TN police book over 2.25 lakh people for not wearing masks
description: All wings of the police force are conducting awareness programmes and a drive against violators of COVID-19 norms

title: Vegetables from Tamil Nadu triple in price in Singapore
description: Tiruchirappalli vegetable markets are humming with activity ahead of the Tamil New Year. Many different traders are packing brinjal, beans, cucumbers, mangoes, bananas and the seasonal palm…

title: Most poll-bound states, save Tamil Nadu, kept testing low till elections
description: Covid-19 testing usually speeds up when local reports indicate a rising positivity rate. But Kerala and Assam dragged on till polls were over, while in West Bengal testing is still disastrously low

title: IPL 2021: Big setback for DC as THIS star player tests COVID-19 positive ahead of RR clash
description: Delhi Capitals pacer Anrich Nortje tested positive while undergoing quarantine.

title: COVID-19: Tamil Nadu Health Department Reports No Shortage of Vaccine Supply | The Weather Channel - Articles from The Weather Channel | weather.com
description: Director of Public health, Dr. T.S. Selvavinayagam said "11,51,450 doses of vaccine are available with us as of April 13, Tuesday. This comprises 9.4 lakh doses of Covishield and 2.1 lakh of Covaxin." - Articles from The Weather Channel | weather.com

title: With subdued gaiety, Tamil Nadu ushers in New Year
description: The Tamil New Year, Pilava, was on Wednesday ushered in with subdued gaiety across Tamil Nadu with a slew of Covid-19 protocols in place for devotees, who usually throng temples in large numbers to celebrate the day.

title: New wave of Covid-19: Younger patients, different symptoms at hospitals in Delhi
description: Doctors in government hospitals in Delhi said that they are seeing younger patients – some even as young as 10 months – and several of them are being brought in varying stages of consciousness

title: Antipsychotics can lower COVID infection, severity risk: Study
description: Patients treated with antipsychotic drugs have a lower risk of becoming infected or suffer a milder form of SARS-CoV-2 -- the virus causing COVID-19 -- if they get infected, according to a study

title: ‘No shortage of oxygen in Tamil Nadu if Covid-19 cases go up’ | Chennai News - Times of India
description: Tamil Nadu is unlikely to face oxygen shortage even if active Covid cases rise above last year’s peak, TNMSC MD P Umanath tells TOI’s Pushpa Narayan.

title: State reports 6,984 new COVID-19 cases
description: 18 more persons die; 49,985 patients under treatment in T.N.; Chennai records 2,482 fresh infections

title: 'Lockdown, not vaccination, behind decline in UK's COVID cases'
description: British Prime Minister Boris Johnson said on Tuesday that lockdown, not the country's vaccine rollout, is the main reason for the decline of COVID-19 infections in Britain

title: Tamil Nadu Covid-19 news live: DMK leader Baalu in hospital after testing Covid positive  - The Times of India
description: Tamil Nadu reported 6,711 new Covid cases and 19 deaths, officials on Monday warned that Chennai, the worst-hit district, could run out of oxygen beds. For the second day, Chennai reported more than 2,000 cases. The Tamil Nadu Directorate of Government Examinations on Monday postponed the Class XII language exam, scheduled to be held on May 3 to May.

title: TN officials say they have adequate doses of COVID-19 vaccine, await arrival of Sputnik V
description: “We have 11,51,450 doses of Covid vaccines in Tamil Nadu right now. Of this, 9.4 lakh is Covishield and 2.1 lakh is Covaxin,” Director of Public Health Dr TS Selvavinayagam told The New Indian Express

title: Vegetables from Tamil Nadu triple in price in Singapore amid Covid-19 pandemic
description: Imports have become costlier due to infrequent passenger flights and increased freight costs.. Read more at straitstimes.com.

title: Delhi, Maharashtra, 8 other states account for 80% of new Covid-19 cases
description: Maharashtra, Uttar Pradesh, Chhattisgarh, Delhi, Karnataka, Tamil Nadu, Madhya Pradesh, Gujarat, Rajasthan and Kerala have shown a rise in the Covid-19 daily cases, the Union Health Ministry said

title: Demonetised currency notes worth Rs 48 mn seized in Tamil Nadu's Sivaganga
description: The police on Monday seized Rs 48 million in demonetised currency notes from Kalayarkoil area of Tamil Nadu's Sivaganga district

title: Tamil Nadu: Protests against cutback on temple festivals amid COVID-19 surge
description: In Tirunelveli, artists urged government to limit the attendance cap for festivals instead of banning the programmes.

title: Police crack down on those violating COVID-19 protocol
description: Over 1.32 lakh cases booked, ₹2.56 crore fine collected since April 8

title: Vaccine fest on; workplace interventions taken up
description: Special camps organised; Health Department planning to intensify efforts from April 14

title: Covid-19: Tamil Nadu government deploys 130 willing doctors from districts in Chennai
description: Apart from that the Indian Medical Association, Tamil Nadu branch also assured that they are ready to help the government come up with the list of private doctors who are willing to work in Chennai.

title: Covid-19: Rajasthan promotes students of Classes 6 and 7 without exams
description: Rajasthan joins Maharashtra, Tamil Nadu, Assam, Odisha, Chhattisgarh and Puducherry who promoted students without examination due to the rise in the number of Covid-19 cases.

title: Election Commission relaxes MCC for COVID-19 related work
description: COVID-19 work, work relating to drinking water and other development work, and a review and implementation of ongoing programmes will be allowed

title: 6,618 persons test positive for COVID-19
description: 2,124 fresh infections in Chennai district; T.N.’s active cases hit 41,995; toll rises to 12,908 with 22 deaths

title: Tamil Nadu adds 6,618 more cases to its COVID-19 tall
description: Tamil Nadu has once again clocked over 6,000 coronavirus infections on a single day, after a gap of nearly seven months, pushing the total caseload to 9.33 lakh. The toll due to COVID-19 rose to 12,908 with 22 more fatalities, the health department said on Sunday.

title: Tamil Nadu govt urged to allow temple festivals | Chennai News - Times of India
description: The government has banned temple events and religious congregations in view of a surge in Covid-19 cases.

title: Tamil Nadu industrialists fear exodus of migrant workers amid covid surge
description: With the second wave of COVID-19 sweeping across various parts of Tamil Nadu, some of the industrialists in the state are apprehensive of migrant workers leaving for their hometowns considering the health conditions

title: COVID-19 second wave: Tamil Nadu industrialists fear another migrant worker exodus
description: The industries recovered from the jolt of the first wave of coronavirus when over one lakh migrant workers from both Coimbatore and Tirupur industries rushed back to their home towns in Bihar, Uttar Pradesh and Odisha by special trains

title: BJP nominee in Tamil Nadu polls, Annamalai tests positive for COVID-19
description: A former Karnataka cadre IPS officer, Annamalai had taken voluntary retirement from service in 2019 and joined the BJP last year.

title: Congress candidate in Tamil Nadu polls, Madhava Rao dies of Covid-19
description:
Congress party's Srivilliputhur
constituency candidate in the April 6 Tamil Nadu Assembly  polls, P S W Madhava Rao died on Sunday due to COVID-19  complications, his family said.

title: Tamil Nadu doctor cures rare condition of ringing ears through microsurgery
description: Venkat, a 26-year-man man, had a strange problem that resulted in him enduring sleepless nights for the last two years. Back in April 2019, Venkat had started experiencing a never-ending ringing noise in his ears

title: Migrants' exodus, scale-up testing: A look at Covid situation in Tamil Nadu districts
description: Coimbatore SIDCO Industrial Estate Manufacturers Welfare Association (COSIEMA) has called on the government to ensure that lockdown is not enforced, as fears remain among migrant workers.

title: Tamil Nadu logs nearly 6,000 new Covid-19 cases, active tally tops 37,000
description: Chennai accounted for most of the new infections with 1,977 cases, taking the aggregate to 2,63,129.Health Secretary J Radhakrishnan said districts like Chennai, Chengalpet, Tiruvallur, Kancheepuram, Coimbatore, Thanjavur, and Nagapattinam were posing a challenge in containing the virus spread

description: MADURAI: The Tamil Nadu Foodgrains Merchants association has expressed disappointment over the new restrictions announced by the state government to c.

title: Tamil Nadu: Increasing COVID-19 Cases, Govt Struggling on Education Front | NewsClick
description: Given the increase in COVID-19 cases, several schools have asked the government to postpone Class 12 state board exams, which is scheduled to begin on May 3. Suggestions of vaccinating the Class 12 students before the board exams have also come up.

title: Tamil Nadu Covid-19 tally breaches 5,000-mark, 23 deaths reported
description: On Friday, about 1,890 positive patients were discharged in the state following treatment and the cumulative figure of recoveries is 8,74,305, according to a state health bulletin
